result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew George Taft

defendant.name: Taft, Andrew George
defendant.address: N49 W5593 Portland Rd 3, Cedarburg, WI 53012

records.addlTxt:
8:48 AM Defendant Andrew George Taft in court.  Attorney Matt Last in court for Andrew George Taft.  Prosecuting attorney Benjamin Lindsay in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel acknowledges receipt of the complaint.  Counsel requests date for preliminary hearing, waiving time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 9, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 136022,
Payable Number: 142133,
Receipt Number: 22R 009999,
Amount: $20.00

9:55 AM Defendant Andrew George Taft in court.  Prosecuting attorney Antonella Aleman-Zientek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant needs more time to obtain funds to retain an attorney.  Court gives final date for defendant to appear with an attorney and finds good cause to extend time limits.
Status hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Status hearing on October 5, 2022 at 08:15 am.

9:23 AM Prosecuting attorney Adam Yale Gerol in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andrew George Taft in court.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint.  Court reviews charges and potential penalties with Defendant.  Court finds probable cause.  Court examines Defendant as to representation by counsel.  Defendant submits Petition for Appointment of Counsel.  Court goes off the record to allow Defendant to complete Petition.  Court back on the record at 9:41 am with same appearances: Defendant resubmits Petition for Appointment of Counsel.  Court examines Defendant as to Petition.  Court denies petition.  Defendant will hire counsel.  Court finds good cause to extend time limits and adjourns to allow Defendant time to hire counsel.
Status hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Status hearing on August 29, 2022 at 08:15 am.

1:21 PM Defendant Andrew George Taft appeared by video, in custody of OZSD . Antonella Aleman-Zientek appears for the State.  Atty Heather Dvoran appears as a friend of the court. Court finds probable cause. Def does not qualify for public defender. Defendant will be hiring counsel. State will be filing a criminal complaint.
Further proceedings scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
No contact with Bozman's Bar in city of Cedarburg. Not to enter any bar or tavern. No contact with F.M. or S. M. Absolute sobriety. Not to possess intoxicants or controlled substances.
